website_summaries.verdict: A premium rain cover that should fit your DSLR camera tightly and securely.
pros: Smaller rain cover than most, which still works well because of the tight fit
Available in a few different sizes
Works equally well with the camera mounted to a tripod or when hand-holding it to shoot
Cover doesn't weigh much, so you'll be able to continue using your camera comfortably in any weather
cons: Expensive, and you may have to purchase some extra straps to achieve a tight fit

customer_reviews.title: Work with it.
customer_reviews.text: I have found that out of all the covers I've researched this is the best. It's light weight, nice looking design and is a little hard to use. thus the 4 stars not five. I do think that after working with it one can be quick and efficient with it. It is what I've seen as the best design in appearance. and not ugly or bulky looking. I own the Canon rebel T5 with a Tamron 70-300 and this shell fits great. This lens is the max size I would go with on this size shell.
customer_reviews.author: Earl L.

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight cover
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight cover! Appears to be well made and of good materials (time will tell). I often carry my Sony A6000 with a zoom-lense around my neck for quick access and have been loking fro a cover that provides some cushioning as well as for weather and dust protection. Most of what I have tried is too bulky, and too slow to deploy camera. This Peak Design cover was exactly want I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: It has a couple of drawbacks like difficulty operating the zoom and focus rings through the thick material, and having to at least slightly uncover the camera to operate the controls, but overall it works great. I like the perfect fit the medium is for my Sony A7R2 with a battery grip.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Good rain protection when not in use.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would like this more, but after having used it a few times on a backpack strap with clip, it seems more cumbersome to use. It really doesn't allow you to use the camera unencumbered like their videos show. It does impede on the speed at which you need - especially when it's raining, which is the main reason why you'd buy this in the first place! Great idea at the onset, but not without some serious workflow issues.
customer_reviews.author: D.Lew

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I’ve used it many times at my kids’ soccer games this past spring. And we just took a trip to Oregon and had it on my camera for two days straight as we went on many hikes and the rain was off and on for the whole time. It makes it so I can use my camera in the rain and not miss any of those moments because I didn’t want my camera to get wet. The material is very nice. Thick and very durable. I can tell this will last me a long time. Very glad I have this!!
customer_reviews.author: LCN

customer_reviews.title: Probably better used for landscape photography on a tripod
customer_reviews.text: decent cover. Probably better used for landscape photography on a tripod. you're not really able to zoom with the shell on so shooting on the run with a zoom isn't worth it. Better to use a prime.
customer_reviews.author: Jac

customer_reviews.title: Well-made product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! It has been on my watch-list for about a year now and I finally pressed the "purchase" button! It protects the camera perfectly. Other reviews mentioned that it was too bulky to shoot from, however, you must remember that the primary job is to keep the camera dry. I feel much more comfortable taking my camera out into nature now knowing that I have a way to protect it from the elements.
customer_reviews.author: AlohaLinds

customer_reviews.title: Worst Peak Design product
customer_reviews.text: I love my Peak Design straps, so I got this product from a great company. Unhappily, this is totally unusable for any camera operation. Even the medium size was too tight to operate my A6000. Thanks goodness for Amazon's liberal return policy for Prime members. Take my advice and just buy some cheap plastic camera covers. Anything is better than this...honestly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Peak Design is unmatched in quality!
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have the budget to buy a weather proof camera, this will do the job and leave it accessible to still shoot! Pair it with the Capture or a Slide Strap and carry your camera everywhere without worry and always get the shot! Peak Design makes sensible accessories with unmatched quality! I have been using these three items for six months and I love them all! I wont carry my camera without all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2

customer_reviews.title: It does not fit all lenses
customer_reviews.text: The image is not explicit enough and the description is void of any mention of what size lens is accommodated by the shell. I wanted to be able to use it with a Nikkor 70-200 (with a teleconverter attached) and that's not possible. I returned the item.
customer_reviews.author: Ragman

customer_reviews.title: Wish it had a clear window to actually see the camera LCD display.
customer_reviews.text: Was going to return but debating on keeping. Love the material, feels great and looks good. The issue I have is once you have the cover on you cannot use the camera unless you remove the back of the cover which doesnt really help in bad weather. A design flaw in my opinion (make a clear window in the back).
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cover
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 80d with most standard zoom lenses just fine and offers a lot of protection from rain and mud. It also still allows the camera to be used with my quick release plates on my tripods and clip.
customer_reviews.author: GrabYourHelmet

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Shell
customer_reviews.text: This camera shell is a great way for me to protect my DSLR from random bonks and dings, and provides weather protection as well. It is lightweight and compressible. It can be used with or without other Peak Design gear. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Shields

customer_reviews.title: Another winner from peak design
customer_reviews.text: Huge fan of peak design, and this gem is another well-thought out piece of kit. Nicely fits my Nikon d3200 w 200mm lense. Much better investment than the plastic covers, with cut-through for strap. If you haven't already you should check out their other great products.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great For Protection, Not For Shooting
customer_reviews.text: We purchased medium for our Nikon D3300. It serves its purpose to protect from rain or dust, but it's very cumbersome to use for shooting. We have to fold back the hood as it will dangle in front of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Coconania

customer_reviews.title: I have not needed it for the rain yet but I think it will work great if needed
customer_reviews.text: I received this a a gift for Christmas. I had seen the a video online about this shell and thought it would be neat to have. I use it to keep my camera safe in my hiking backpack. I have not needed it for the rain yet but I think it will work great if needed. I use it on a Canon 80d and it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Pat DoughertyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great addition for Outdoor Photography
customer_reviews.text: Snug fit for a Canon 5D Mark III. Good weather and sand protection. Easy to work with and clean.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: Mine came with a small hole
customer_reviews.text: Small hole on 44 dollar rain shell. It is where the pull tab is to make the shell tighter. Even though the hole is small I can foresee it getting bigger in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Went hiking in the Pacific Northwest and wanted to keep my camera dry. This did the trick, although it was a little cumbersome to lift up the cover to use the camera. Perhaps I don't have the hang of it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent! The quality and functionality are really top notch. I used this with my Sony A7III and a 70-200f4 outside for a 9 hour shoot at a race where it poured. The camera was dry and I was impressed with the usability.
customer_reviews.author: 125freeskier

customer_reviews.title: Great when using in auto
customer_reviews.text: Great but lose a lot more functionality of the camera. Best if used when not manually adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Keep my camera in my glove box and this shell protects it a little move.
customer_reviews.author: Add1x7

customer_reviews.title: Hiking use and it was awesome
customer_reviews.text: Use this when I go hiking... effectively keeps a lot of dust and dirt out but also is great when it rains. Kept camera dry as we continued to hike through the rain
customer_reviews.author: Johnsum2010

customer_reviews.title: Great Protection
customer_reviews.text: Great Rain protection for the A6000. Can’t say enough about Peak Design on there products.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality as with most Peak Design gear
customer_reviews.text: Great quality as with most Peak Design gear. Used during a week-long trip in northern France where it rained a good bit and kept my camera perfectly dry.

customer_reviews.title: Great product as well as their camera straps
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly accommodates my Panasonic mirrorless camera with my longest, attached lens. Great product as well as their camera straps!

customer_reviews.text: Perfect rain/snow cover for almost any DSLR Camera. Lightweight, compactable and it does the trick!

customer_reviews.title: The rain cover is perfect for my Olympus OM D E1
customer_reviews.text: The rain cover is perfect for my Olympus OM D E1, with my long zoom lens. Will be great while traveling in possible rain areas.
customer_reviews.author: Joan P.

customer_reviews.title: Quality👍
customer_reviews.text: Peak design makes very good quality products. 2nd item I have purchased from them and will not be the last.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Protection
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for the beach and kept the sand and sun off.

customer_reviews.title: Love it for my Nikon D3400 - perfect coverage
customer_reviews.text: Love it for my Nikon D3400 - perfect coverage: doesn't get in the way, but still makes me feel like my DSLR is protected.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fit
customer_reviews.text: Fits snugly to my camera even with my 70- 200 lens on. Easy to fit.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and store.
customer_reviews.text: Good design. Like the protective fabric and easy to store when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: PLVarner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love all Peak Design's stuff. They are my go-to camera gear company.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer J Adams

customer_reviews.title: Good product but a practical use problem.
customer_reviews.text: Meh, I didn't really like it and removed it after a week. My problem was getting the proper clearance for the top camera controls. The cover should slide higher over the straps but it's just a couple inches until your hung up on the wide portion of the strap, if I'm explaining it correctly. This makes access to the front portion of the top controls very difficult. The rain protection is there, it fits the A7 rather well with a larger zoom lens. Quality of the material is good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sanook

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a low profile weather cover for my cameras for years! Everything up until now has been bulky, intrusive, or impractical. Peak Design is really raising the bar for ultra high quality products with amazing design and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: MJG

customer_reviews.title: it would work great. If you need to change mods or settings
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to offer a little protection from scuffs. It is a little difficult to use the camera when installed. If you only want to take a picture and not changed any settings, it would work great. If you need to change mods or settings, it is a little more cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Just okay.
customer_reviews.text: Disapointing product. Very good material as always with Peak Design but this time it's not that pratical to use.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Great camera cover if you never take it off or use the camera.
customer_reviews.text: Product is great for protecting camera from becoming wet - if you never use it. But to get it to work, you need to buy Peak's proprietary strap to hang the camera around your neck. And to shoot pics, you need to uncover the camera to look into the eyefinder or the screen, so the camera gets wet when you do that. Moreover, focusing the lens is a PITA because it's hard to turn the barrel thru the thick neoprene cover and you cannot extend or retract the lens fully and I felt it was messing up the focusing mechanism of the lens. The product is just a disaster.
customer_reviews.author: Clevor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera cover
customer_reviews.text: I finally had to break this out on a hiking trip. Works very well and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: H. Giles
